file_content.text: My superiors have been asking about you. There is some intrigue happening with House Rist, trouble for our allies.
If you're interested, look for Dathis Elgin. Moff Sarek has already commended you to him.
The Ulgos have retreated from these lands, thanks to you.
Thank you. You are again Thul's savior, saving our lands from devastation and death.
Thank you. Thul's population would have been devastated by that weapon.
I am in awe of your accomplishments.
Your heroism will serve as an inspiration for the rest of my career.
The abilities of the Sith are truly beyond the capacity of the rest of us to understand.
I had wondered why an outsider was entrusted with so many secrets of the Empire. Now I see there is no one else whose abilities compare.
I'm proud to have served the Empire.
It was only my duty.
Do those words translate into credits?
Praise is cheap.
I can certainly offer you a bonus for your service, bounty hunter.
No big deal.
Then we must bow to your skill even more, for it is more than any of our troops could do.
Then we're through?
Yes. I will not keep you from your business.
With the Ulgos retreating, I can turn all my troops to rooting out the Killiks--to the last squirming larva.
The Ulgos have retreated to mourn their casualties. Perhaps I should do the same.
Once you've entered the launch codes, leave the area immediately.
General Thul, excuse me. I heard my rescuers have returned. It is urgent I speak with them.
General Thul, excuse me. It is urgent I speak with my rescuer at once.
I am agent Craige Graf, Imperial Intelligence. It was no accident those Killiks attacked when they did. The Ulgos pushed them toward that mine.
Are the mines so important?
Why?
The mines are nothing--not until we get production going on lanthanide. It was a decoy.
Is that solid intel?
We've been monitoring communications between the Ulgo strike teams in that region. This was definitely planned.
You make a habit of getting captured on your missions?
Not much of an agent.
Of course not... but the Killiks share a mind. Once one sees you, there's no escape.
We didn't even have time to activate a comlink, report what we'd learned.
The push was orchestrated by the Ulgos, to distract us from something they're calling "Operation Sun Shower."
I suggest we make sure their plan doesn't work.
I'm not distracted.
What else?
You Alderaanians are entirely too cheerful.
Seriously? Sun Shower?
I've heard that term. It's come up a few times in the chatter we're getting from our back door into the Organa networks.
I've heard that name come up a few times. No one's copped to knowing about it in our interrogations.
It's a baradium detonator, a massive explosive. They plan to strike at the heart of Thul lands.
The detonator's being transported by Bouris Ulgo's elite soldiers, former Republic special forces, with the best weapons they could take and all the training the Republic gave them.
If Republic soldiers could stand against the Sith, they would not have surrendered at Coruscant.
I'm not afraid.
No one in the Republic understands what the dark side is capable of.
They cannot defeat the Force.
I won't let them get a direct shot in.
Forewarned is forearmed.
Maybe I can pick up something nice once they're dead.
Good.
Kill the soldiers, steal the weapon?
What's the plan?
I'll kill them all.
Just before the Killiks arrived, we acquired a data file that I believe to be the launch codes for the detonator.
If you really wish to strike fear into the heart of the Ulgos, get into the camp where they're holding it and set it off prematurely.
It won't be the full force of the weapon, but let it be Ulgo that perishes--not Thul.
Thank you. My medics are treating the inspection team for shock, but they seem otherwise unharmed.
I wish I could say the same for my daughter.
I have heard nothing. Did you not find her?
She has embraced the Killiks' ways. I would not force her to return.
Daria wanted to stay.
Her mind is gone. She's no more than their slave now.
The Killiks brainwashed her.
Those monsters!
I've heard of this. They call it "the Joining." Some drug those horrors secrete that brainwashes their victims.
You should have dragged her away. There must be a way to recover....
I'm sorry. I was too late to save her.
She's dead. [Lie.]
No! Why Daria? The Imperials, they report they were not mistreated. What did my poor girl do?
She is at peace now. Honor that and return to your duties.
Let her go.
It is clear those monsters have drugged her, brainwashed her.
I've heard of this, something in the pheromones that joins their captives to their hive mind.
She may still recover. Be patient with her.
Give her time.
I only wish I could have protected her.
Turn Thul's troops against the Killiks before they can destroy another mind.
You must take revenge.
You're right. What good is the throne of Alderaan if our world is first overrun by these bugs? They must be driven out.
We should slaughter them until nothing but their mounds remain--
Please hurry. My daughter's life may depend on how quickly you reach those mines.
Stanel Thul? I was told you want to see me?
Yes. Moff Sarek said you'd be here. We've had an inspection team lost to the Killiks for days now. Advisors from Dromund Kaas.
They were inspecting one of our mining sites for lanthanide deposits.
Greetings, my lord. We don't often see Sith on Alderaan.
My greetings, sir. Dare I say you have the look of the Empire about you?
My greetings, bounty hunter. I can hazard a guess as to who you're after this time.
My greetings.
I trust you're here to find out what happened to the Imperial inspection team?
Let's start with you, then we can talk about what I'm doing.
Who are you?
Are there Imperial citizens in trouble?
Inspection team?
Yes.
Depends if you're planning to pay for the answer.
Inspection team?
If you can find it, I assure you the answer to that question is worth a great deal.
I have personal reasons.
I didn't mean to presume. I just thought--let me start over.
I'm Stanel Thul, general of the Thul forces in this region. We recently had a large Imperial contingent arrive from Dromund Kaas to inspect our mines for lanthanide deposits.
But in the middle of their inspection, the entire place was overrun by Killiks. We've had no communication for days.
I want the full briefing--risk assessment, strategic importance, all of it.
Give me the details.
Who's that? Some other noble house?
Killiks?
Killiks are the native aliens here. Giant bugs with just enough brains to hold a blaster.
Moff Sarek wants this team back--apparently, some of them hold serious rank offworld--but the rest of House Thul is balking.
Sounds like your problem.
Moff Sarek wants the inspection team rescued, and fast. Apparently, some of them hold serious rank offworld.
And the Killiks don't exactly respond to negotiations. They're the native aliens here, giant bugs with just enough sentience to shoot a blaster.
Attacking these Killiks would take half our army. But apparently I'm "too close to the problem to strategically assess its value."
No Sith would fear a mere bug.
I'm worth half an army.
If you help, House Thul will be in your debt. And I will commend you to Moff Sarek--whatever you want me to say.
Armies do balk at trying something that will leave half of them dead.
Unfortunate.
If you can do what they cannot, I will owe you a debt I can never repay.
It's not only the inspection team. My daughter is in there, too. I don't know if she's alive or dead.
Sounds like there may be someone specific you want rescued.
But you're trying anyway.
Yes. Yes, it's true. My daughter, she was leading the inspection team.
Lay it out, then. What's the mission?
So you're hiring me instead.
Go to the mines, find the team and free any who still live. Whatever you can do to hurt the Killiks, do it.
And... there's--my daughter. She was leading the team. If you save her, I promise as great a reward as I can muster.
You have some kind of personal stake in this?
Too close to the problem?
Yes. I--I don't want you to think I'm asking for personal reasons, but my daughter was leading the inspection team.
Sounds right to me.
Wait! There's more to it. My daughter was leading that team.
I don't know if she's alive or dead.
If you can find her, find our advisors, free them if they're prisoners, I promise you a reward that will leave me bankrupt.
I will not let these aliens kill your daughter or the advisors.
You have nothing to fear.
Thank you. For myself even more than for my house.
You start digging into that treasury. I'll get everyone out of that mine that walks on two legs.
I like rewards.
If you rescue Daria, I will gladly give you my every last credit.
Not my thing. [Refuse quest]
Then I fear my daughter and our men are lost forever.
We lack the men to split our forces between the Ulgos and the Killiks.
